snippet: A State Supreme Court justice said the law, which provided for 18,000 new “hail licenses” for livery cabs serving northern Manhattan and the outer boroughs, violated the State Constitution.
abstract: Justice Arthur F Engoron of New York State Supreme Court in Manhattan rebuffs law passed by the State Legislature that would expand New York City taxicab street hail service beyond Manhattan; says law was passed after the Bloomberg administration had been stymied by the City Council, move that is a violation of the State Constitution; ruling signals an uncertain future for livery taxis in the city and a victory for the yellow-cab industry.
lead_paragraph: A State Supreme Court justice said the law, which provided for 18,000 new “hail licenses” for livery cabs serving northern Manhattan and the outer boroughs, violated the State Constitution.

headline.seo: Law Expanding New York City Taxi System Overturned by Court
headline.main: Court Overturns Law Expanding Taxi Service
headline.print_headline: Court Overturns Law Expanding Taxi Service
